Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.Presniakov_Arsenii.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.Presniakov_Arsenii.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Impler, JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements JarImpler
The Implementor class is used to produce classes implementing interface which is specified by provided token.

  • Method Details

    • write_utf

      void write_utf(String text, Writer writer) throws IOException
      Writes text to writer in UTF-8.
      Parameters:
      text - String to write.
      writer - Writer destination.
      Throws:
      IOException - if exception is occurred while writing

    • implement

      public void implement(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Produces code implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added. Generated source code should be placed in the correct subdirectory of the specified root directory and have correct file name. For example, the implementation of the interface List should go to $root/java/util/ListImpl.java

      Specified by:
      implement in interface Impler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      root - root directory.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar(Class<?> token, Path jarFile) throws ImplerException
      Produces .jar file implementing class or interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class' name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added.

      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface JarImpler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      jarFile - target .jar file.
      Throws:
      ImplerException - when implementation cannot be generated.

    • createJar

      private static void createJar(Path root, Path classFile, Path jarFile) throws ImplerException
      Creates a jar file from the compiled java class.
      Parameters:
      root - Path to directory where the compiled java class is located
      classFile - package path resolved with file path of a class which will be included in jar
      jarFile - path to jar file
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if IOException is thrown while writing to jar

    • compile

      private static void compile(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Compiles java code which is generated by implement(Class, Path).
      Parameters:
      token - class token which implementation is going to be compiled
      root - Path of directory where .java file is located
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if URISyntaxException is thrown while creating classpath

    • getFullPath

      private static Path getFullPath(Class<?> token, Path root) throws ImplerException
      Returns Path to root resolved with getFilePath(Class, String), where extension is "java". Creates all directories on the path
      Parameters:
      token - token of Class or Interface which file Path to get
      root - Path to the directory, where the class specified by token will be located
      Returns:
      root.resolve(getFilePath(token, "java"))
      Throws:
      ImplerException - if IOException is thrown while creating directories

    • getFilePath

      private static Path getFilePath(Class<?> token, String extension)
      Returns Path from getPackagePath(Class) to file of class or interface specified by token. "." is replaced with File.Separator. extension is added in the end of path
      Parameters:
      token - token of Class or Interface which file Path to get
      extension - string value of required extension
      Returns:
      getPackagePath(token).resolve(Path.of(implClassName(token) + "." + extension))

    • getPackagePath

      private static Path getPackagePath(Class<?> token)
      Returns Path to package of class or interface specified by . "." is replaced with File.Separator
      Parameters:
      token - token of Class or Interface which package Path to get
      Returns:
      Path.of(token.getPackageName().replace(".", File.separator))

    • packageStatement

      private static String packageStatement(Class<?> token)
      Generates and returns package statement of class or interface specified by
      Parameters:
      token - token of Class or Interface which package statement to generate
      Returns:
      "package " + token.getPackageName() + ";" + System.lineSeparator()

    • implClassName

      private static String implClassName(Class<?> token)
      Returns simple name of class or interface specified by + Impl
      Parameters:
      token - token of Class or Interface which name to generate
      Returns:
      token.getSimpleName() + "Impl"

    • classSignature

      private static String classSignature(Class<?> token)
      Generates and returns whole signature of class implementing interface specified by token, including classModifiers(Class), implClassName(Class) implementing token.getCanonicalName()
      Parameters:
      token - token of Class or Interface which signature to generate
      Returns:
      whole signature of the specified class

    • classModifiers

      private static String classModifiers(Class<?> token)
      Generates and returns modifiers of class or interface specified by without abstract, interface, static and protected modifiers.
      Parameters:
      token - token of Class or Interface which modifiers will be generated
      Returns:
      Modifier.toString(token.getModifiers() & ~Modifier.ABSTRACT & ~Modifier.INTERFACE & ~Modifier.STATIC & ~Modifier.PROTECTED)

    • methodSignature

      private static String methodSignature(Method method)
      Generates and returns the whole signature of method, including @Override statement, methodModifiers(Method) statement, methodArguments(Method) statement, methodExceptions(Method) statement and methodDefinition(Method) statement
      Parameters:
      method - Method class which signature will be generated
      Returns:
      the signature of method

    • methodModifiers

      private static String methodModifiers(Method method)
      Generates and returns modifiers of method without abstract and transient modifiers.
      Parameters:
      method - Method class which modifiers will be generated
      Returns:
      Modifier.toString(method.getModifiers() & ~Modifier.ABSTRACT & ~Modifier.TRANSIENT)

    • methodArguments

      private static String methodArguments(Method method)
      Generates and returns all method parameters.
      Parameters:
      method - Method class which parameters will be generated
      Returns:
      "(" + all method.getParameters() types canonical names and parameter names with ", " as a delimiter + ")"

    • methodExceptions

      private static String methodExceptions(Method method)
      Generates and returns exception statement of method.
      Parameters:
      method - Method class which exception statement will be generated
      Returns:
      "" if method.getExceptionTypes().length == 0, " throws " + all method.getExceptionTypes() canonical names with ", " as a delimiter

    • methodDefinition

      private static String methodDefinition(Method method)
      Generates and returns default body of method.
      Parameters:
      method - Method class which body will be generated
      Returns:
      "{}" if method.getReturnType() == void.class, default method body with return value getDefaultValue(Class)

    • getDefaultValue

      private static String getDefaultValue(Class<?> token)
      Returns the string.valueOf() of the default value of the class specified by token.
      Parameters:
      token - class token which default value is needed
      Returns:
      "0" if token == char.class or token == char.class, String.valueOf(Array.get(Array.newInstance(token, 1), 0)) otherwise

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main class for Implementor.

      If the first argument is "-jar", runs implementJar(Class, Path). Otherwise, runs implement(Class, Path). Next two arguments define token and path of the required java or jar file.

      If any argument of the args is null or args is null itself or args doesn't match cases described above prints an error message.

      Parameters:
      args - an array of arguments
